mosimage.caption: From left: Jeff Williams, Tim Kopra and Tim Peake

story.storykicker: Facebook Live chat between Mark Zuckerberg and astronauts Jeff Williams, Tim Kopra and Tim Peake: Scroll to watch the video.
story.storybody:
Facebook Live has reached space, ladies and gentlemen!

On Wednesday, June 1, Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg had a live chat with three astronauts aboard the International Space Station. The three astronauts were Jeff Williams, Tim Kopra from NASA and Tim Peake from the United Kingdom Space Agency (UKSA).

Here are some key highlights of the live chat:

  • The livestream got a huge response. It had 2.6 million viewers at press time
  • The three astronauts talked about their experience in space and how they observed different aspects of the Earth
  • Zuckerberg read out questions from the comment section to the astronauts and even added a few questions from his side
  • Kopra explained how living in space is in itself an experiment, that shows the effect of microgravity on a human body
  • This was the first space mission for Tim Peake, and he has been up there for six months. According to Peake, there are many things about living in space that you cannot learn in training
  • Peake said, "As a rookie astronaut on my first flight, there were so many new experiences. The training is phenomenal, and we have a wonderful training team all around the world, in all our international sites�?� But it's the real experience of launching in a Soyuz rocket, seeing that first orbit of planet Earth going through a sunset, seeing a moonrise, seeing a sunrise. You can't put into words how beautiful a planet is from up here."
  • They use virtual reality techs in the Space Station Hall to get a feel of home
  • The astronauts talk in English and Russian among themselves
  • Kopra and Peake will be returning to the Earth on June 18 while Williams will be home in September
  • American astronaut Kate Rubins, Russian cosmonaut Anatoly Ivanishin and Japanese astronaut Takuya Onishi will take charge of their roles.

 

WATCH:

First Facebook LIVE chat in space: Mark Zukcerberg and Astronauts aboard International Space Station

{blurb}
